meanings.definition: In a clumsy or awkward manner
meanings.sent1: He tripped maladroitly over the uneven pavement.
meanings.sent2: She danced maladroitly at the school talent show.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to pull a rabbit out of his hat, but ended up maladroitly dropping it on the floor.
meanings.sent4: The new student navigated the school hallways maladroitly, bumping into lockers like a pinball.
meanings.sent5: The chef chopped vegetables maladroitly, sending pieces flying in all directions.

meanings.definition: Showing a lack of skill or ability
meanings.sent1: His maladroitly crafted birdhouse fell apart as soon as a bird landed on it.
meanings.sent2: The maladroitly written essay received a low grade from the teacher.
meanings.sent3: The maladroitly painted mural on the wall looked more like a child's doodle.
meanings.sent4: The maladroitly assembled puzzle had several pieces left over at the end.
meanings.sent5: The maladroitly played piano piece sounded more like a jumble of notes than a melody.
